page.title: 09LIFE-STYLES LOCAL PUB
page.content: The Cross Keys Public House is well over 200 years old,and has always been known by this name.Originally it was owned and run by a Chester brewery, today,by the Greenhall Whitley Company.In the past it was used as a coaching house and the building where the horses and coaches were kept is still standing and is now used as a changing room for the local football team.The hitching rail is still visible in a corner at the rear of the building.The bottle room above the stables is called the Band Room where in 1911 Northop Silver Prize Band first formed and practised.The Cross Keys used to be one of four pubs in the village but now it is the only one left.About a hundred years ago an extension was built to the main building in keeping with the original architecture.
